publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1539 Dorothy-Grace Elder: Testing of Depleted Uranium Shells in the Solway Firth—That the Parliament calls for a stop to a new series of testing by the Ministry of Defence of depleted uranium (DU) shells in the Solway Firth; urges an investigation by national and international experts into cancer levels in the population of the area and for tests on fish in the Firth following around 6,000 DU shells being fired there over 20 years, and shares the view of Dr John Large, a nuclear scientist and adviser to Her Majesty's Government, who is concerned about particles exploding from DU shells being blown over nearby populations.
S1M-1539 Testing of Depleted Uranium Shells in the Solway Firth (lodged on 15 January 2001) Christine Grahame*, Alex Neil*, Shona Robison*
S1M-1539 Testing of Depleted Uranium Shells in the Solway Firth (lodged on 15 January 2001) Kay Ullrich*, Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-1539 Dorothy-Grace Elder: Testing of Depleted Uranium Shells in the Solway Firth—That the Parliament calls for a stop to a new series of testing by the Ministry of Defence of depleted uranium (DU) shells in the Solway Firth; urges an investigation by national and international experts into cancer levels in the population of the area and for tests on fish in the Firth following around 6,000 DU shells being fired there over 20 years, and shares the view of Dr John Large, a nuclear scientist and adviser to Her Majesty's Government, who is concerned about particles exploding from DU shells being blown over nearby populations. Supported by: Christine Grahame, Alex Neil, Shona Robison, Kay Ullrich, Tommy Sheridan
